text:
Hi. Two coffees?
On the house.

We're good,
but thank you so much

and thanks for letting us
shoot our interview here.

Oh, no problem. And if you
want any dirt on Holly,

well, you know,
when she was younger,

I'd be more than happy
to oblige.
Grandma!
As tempting as that sounds,

I only need to talk
to Holly and Oscar for now.
Oh, uh, sure. Okay.
( woman laughs )

Can you tell us a bit
about the open mic
you run here, Holly?

- This is a very cute setup.
- Oh, yeah.

Um, well, actually, my grandma
ran one when she was younger

and it inspired me
to do the same.

Can you tell me a bit about
how you two work together?

I mean, the songs
are all Holly.

I just helped with
the production a bit.

He means he makes me
sound amazing.

I heard there's a new musical
going up in town,

directed by
Jason Ryan Reeves, no less.

Seems like something a musical
firecracker like yourself
would be involved in, Holly.

Um, yeah.
Uh, no. Not this time.
Let's talk about your song.

You refer to making it
through the dark.

Oh, yeah, that was just
kind of like a metaphor.

Really? Because it feels
like you're writing

about something bad
that happened to you.

Um, I mean it was just
kind of like a general dark.

Grandma: You know, if you
want to get to know Holly,

you should really
get to know her town.
Why don't you give them a tour?

Uh, yeah. This town is what
made me who I am today.
Then let's go.

And over there
you'll see Town Square.

Seems like a pretty idyllic
place to grow up in.

I wouldn't be the same person
I am today without Collinsville.

I feel pretty lucky
to call it home.

Do you find it hard to find
things to write about?
Seems pretty sleepy around here.

Oh, that actually
hasn't been an issue.

- ( door opening )
- Jason: Savannah!

How dare you run out
during rehearsal.
Who do you think you are?
Get back in there. Now.
Any idea what's going on there?
No. Not at all.

Why don't we head this way?
I can show you the site

of the famous
Collinsville cuckoo heist.

- Sounds good.
- 'Kay.
